reviews.text:
Seems to be a nice and small station with both intercity and local trains stopping here. Step free access is available here via lifts on the footbridge as well as seating, toilets and shelter for the rain. 

No ticket barriers are here but there are ticket machines and a ticket office with friendly staff.

Do take care when boarding trains here. The gap and step down is insane.

This is a attractive station with good amenities and offers useful services between Birmingham and London. It is often not staffed, however, even in peak times, meaning no ticket office or waiting rooms. There have recently been problems with the ticket machine too. So allow time for queues if you need to buy a ticket and be prepared to stand out in the cold.

Beautiful little station which is situated in the centre of the village. Also for a little bit of history. It was first named Knowle, then Knowle and Dorridge then Dorridge. Nice little cafe for refreshments and a old day waiting room. Also the local station for the people of Knowle and Bentley Heath (serving the area of KDBH)
The station ticket master was most helpful...thanks for your help with sorting out my ticket today. Best customer service!
Always good coffee and cake and biscuits for Molly our dog
